title: Shouldn't we love Allah instead of loving the Prophetﷺ as everything was given to him ﷺ by ALLAH
transcript:
[Questioner] from India okay here so Sheikh 
my question is before I studied Aqeedah I   used to believe that self-amazement is halal 
and that the credit of my good deed goes to   me why should we love Prophet Muhammad (Peace 
and Blessings Upon Him) if all the credit of   his Good Deeds Goes to Allah our Good Deeds 
are gifts from Allah all the good deeds of   Prophet Muhammad (Peace and Blessings Upon Him) 
were gifted to him by Allah so if Allah is the   one who gifted him why should we love Muhammad 
(Peace and Blessings Upon Him) shouldn't we love   Allah instead of loving him if Allah tells 
you to love him what are you going to say   I have to obey him so what this question is a 
clear manifestation of how shaytan is messing up   with your head and if you're studying Aqeedah and 
you come up with such a question you are studying   something wrong or you're selling out on your own 
not with not with Scholars this is dangerous if   it takes you to this level Allah tells you to love 
Muhammad (Peace and Blessings Upon Him) and Allah   tells you if you don't love Muhammad (Peace and 
Blessings Upon Him) you will not enter Jannah and   it is one of the pillars of Islam to believe that 
Prophet (Peace and Blessings Upon Him) is Allah's   messenger and servant and this entails that you 
believe him in whatever he tells and that you   refrain from whatever he tells you to refrain 
and to do whatever he ordered you to do and not   to worship Allah except with what he had ordered 
you to do and if you don't love him then you will   not be a believer as the prophet said no one will 
become a Believer until I that is Prophet Muhammad   is more beloved to him than his wife his 
parents his family his wealth and himself   so this is the essence of Islam to love 
Allah azzawajal and to love those whom   Allah told you to love and on the top of the list 
is Prophet Muhammad (Peace and Blessings Upon Him)
